segment.source: Specify corporate-owned devices with international mobile equipment identity (IMEI) numbers
segment.target: Specify corporate-owned devices with international mobile equipment identity (IMEI) numbers

segment.source: Specify corporate-owned devices with international mobile equipment identity (IMEI) numbers
segment.target: Specify corporate-owned devices with international mobile equipment identity (IMEI) numbers

segment.source: Microsoft Intune enables administrators to import international mobile equipment identity (IMEI) numbers for mobile device platforms with an IMEI numbers to help identify corporate-owned mobile devices.
segment.target: Microsoft Intune enables administrators to import international mobile equipment identity (IMEI) numbers for mobile device platforms with an IMEI numbers to help identify corporate-owned mobile devices.

segment.source: Once enrolled in Intune, devices with imported IMEI numbers are tagged as Corporate which can be used for applying policies that are different than those applied to personally owned devices.
segment.target: Once enrolled in Intune, devices with imported IMEI numbers are tagged as Corporate which can be used for applying policies that are different than those applied to personally owned devices.

segment.source: Add International Mobile Equipment Identity (IMEI) Numbers to Intune
segment.target: Add International Mobile Equipment Identity (IMEI) Numbers to Intune

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console go Groups > All Devices > All Corporate Pre-enrolled Devices > By IMEI (All platforms), and then click Add devices….
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console go Groups > All Devices > All Corporate Pre-enrolled Devices > By IMEI (All platforms), and then click Add devices….

segment.source: You can add devices in two ways:
segment.target: You can add devices in two ways:

segment.source: Upload a CSV file containing serial numbers – Create a comma-separated value (.csv) list of two columns without a header, limited to 5000 devices or 5MB per csv file.
segment.target: Upload a CSV file containing serial numbers – Create a comma-separated value (.csv) list of two columns without a header, limited to 5000 devices or 5MB per csv file.

segment.source: <IMEI #1>
segment.target: <IMEI #1>

segment.source: <Device #1 Details>
segment.target: <Device #1 Details>

segment.source: <IMEI #2>
segment.target: <IMEI #2>

segment.source: <Device #2 Details>
segment.target: <Device #2 Details>

segment.source: This .csv file when viewed in a text editor appears as:
segment.target: This .csv file when viewed in a text editor appears as:

segment.source: Manually add device details - Enter the IMEI number and device details of up to five devices
segment.target: Manually add device details - Enter the IMEI number and device details of up to five devices

segment.source: Details are for administrative use so you can identify which IMEI number is associated with a device.
segment.target: Details are for administrative use so you can identify which IMEI number is associated with a device.

segment.source: This information is not sent to the device but will appear in the Intune console.
segment.target: This information is not sent to the device but will appear in the Intune console.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Review Devices pane you can confirm which device IMEI numbers are imported.
segment.target: On the Review Devices pane you can confirm which device IMEI numbers are imported.

segment.source: You can also decide whether to overwrite the Details for IMEI numbers being re-imported.
segment.target: You can also decide whether to overwrite the Details for IMEI numbers being re-imported.

segment.source: You can uncheck the Overwrite checkbox to preserve the Current details.
segment.target: You can uncheck the Overwrite checkbox to preserve the Current details.

segment.source: Click Finish to import the IMEI numbers.
segment.target: Click Finish to import the IMEI numbers.

segment.source: The added IMEI numbers and descriptions are added to the By IMEI (All platforms) list.
segment.target: The added IMEI numbers and descriptions are added to the By IMEI (All platforms) list.

segment.source: When the device with that IMEI number enrolls, usually when a user installs the Company Portal app and completes the enrollment process, the device will be tagged as Corporate owned and appear as enrolled in the IMEI Devices group.
segment.target: When the device with that IMEI number enrolls, usually when a user installs the Company Portal app and completes the enrollment process, the device will be tagged as Corporate owned and appear as enrolled in the IMEI Devices group.
